intro: Stenandrium trinerve, commonly known as the three-veined stenandrium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with three prominent veins. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Stenandrium trinerve is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
